framework.control

Class ControlInterfaceConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.control.ControlInterfaceConnector

  • public final class ControlInterfaceConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Connector to the framework for control interfaces. Here the ID of the control interface is added as a token and the CI's state is checked.
    Author:
    Stefan Werner

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addConnection

        public boolean addConnection(ConnectionSummary connectionSummary)
                      throws AuthorizationException,
                             ControlInterfaceException
        Adds a module connection.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP

        Required rights: MANAGE_MODULES_AND_CONNECTIONS

        Parameters:
        connectionSummary - the connection summary
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • addControlInterface

        public java.lang.String addControlInterface(java.lang.String ciType,
                                            int rights)
                                     throws AuthorizationException,
                                            ControlInterfaceException
        Adds a new control interface.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING

        Required rights: MANAGE_CIS

        Parameters:
        ciType - the CI type
        rights - the rights
        Returns:
        the CI ID
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • addGeneralEventListener

        public boolean addGeneralEventListener(GeneralEventListener generalEventListener,
                                       GeneralEventType... desiredEventTypes)
                                throws AuthorizationException,
                                       ControlInterfaceException
        Adds a general event listener.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING

        Required rights: RCV_CONN_UPDATE, RCV_LOG_EVENT, RCV_MOD_ACT, RCV_MOD_AND_PORT_UPDATE (depends on event type)

        IMPORTANT: You can actually skip desiredEventTypes or just use framework.model.event.type.GeneralEventType.GeneralEvent to add an "catch all" listener but this is discouraged to avoid flooding with unnecessary event. Of course CI will only receive events it holds appropriate rights for.

        Parameters:
        generalEventListener - the general event listener
        desiredEventTypes - the desired event types
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • addModule

        public ModuleSummary addModule(java.lang.String moduleType,
                               int rights)
                        throws AuthorizationException,
                               ControlInterfaceException
        Adds a new module.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP

        Required rights: MANAGE_MODULES_AND_CONNECTIONS

        Parameters:
        moduleType - the module type
        rights - the rights
        Returns:
        the module summary
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • checkCIState

        private void checkCIState()
                   throws ControlInterfaceException
        Checks if this connector may be used for calls to the framework. Currently it cannot be used from inside the CI's constructor.
        Throws:
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state

      • exit

        public void exit(boolean force)
          throws AuthorizationException,
                 ControlInterfaceException
        Exits the system.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP, BROKER_RUNNING

        Required rights: CONTROL_STATE

        Parameters:
        force - set to true to force exit even if components fail to stop
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • exportConfiguration

        public boolean exportConfiguration(java.io.OutputStream out,
                                   boolean exportPortConnections,
                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.String> moduleIdsToExport,
                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ciIdsToExport)
                            throws AuthorizationException,
                                   ControlInterfaceException
        Exports configuration (database).

        Required rights: MANAGE_DATABASE

        Parameters:
        out - the output stream to write to
        exportPortConnections - set to true to export port connections
        moduleIdsToExport - the module IDs to export
        ciIdsToExport - the CI IDs to export
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedControlInterfaceCommands(java.lang.String moduleId)
                                                                     throws AuthorizationException,
                                                                            ControlInterfaceException
        Gets the supported control interface commands from a given module.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP

        Required rights: MANAGE_MODULES_AND_CONNECTIONS

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        Returns:
        the supported control interface commands (may be null, for example if module does not answer before a timeout occurs)
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • sendControlInterfaceCommand

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sendControlInterfaceCommand(java.lang.String moduleId,
                                                                                    java.lang.String command,
                                                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
                                                                             throws AuthorizationException,
                                                                                    ControlInterfaceException
        Sends control interface command to given module.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP

        Required rights: MANAGE_MODULES_AND_CONNECTIONS

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID to send command to
        command - the command
        properties - the properties (may be null)
        Returns:
        the answer from module (may be null, for example if module does not answer before a timeout occurs)
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • setControlInterfaceRights

        public boolean setControlInterfaceRights(java.lang.String ciId,
                                         int newRights)
                                  throws AuthorizationException,
                                         ControlInterfaceException
        Sets the rights of a given control interface.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING

        Required rights: MANAGE_CIS

        Parameters:
        ciId - the CI ID to set rights for
        newRights - the new rights
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

                 throws AuthorizationException,

      • stopBroker

        public void stopBroker()
                throws AuthorizationException,
                       ControlInterfaceException
        Stops broker.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP, BROKER_STOPPED_AND_READY

        Required rights: CONTROL_STATE

        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
